intro: Astragalus tuna-ekimii, commonly known as the Turkish milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus tuna-ekimii is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
